info.name: Day 30: Submit a pull request
info.description:
## Instructions for Day 30: Submit a pull request

1. **Get the challenge:** Fork [the parent collection `Day 30: Submit a pull request`](https://www.postman.com/postman/workspace/30-days-of-postman-for-developers/documentation/1559645-88dc2f3e-8335-40f5-857d-cc053bdaa8ee) to your own public workspace.
2. **Read the documentation:** In your fork, select the first folder. Expand the context bar on the right to follow the instructions in the collection documentation.
3. **Submit your solution:** Select the second folder `Submit a PR` and follow the instructions in the documentation to validate your solution.

## Concepts covered
- [Examples](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/examples/)
- [Creating pull requests](https://learning.postman.com/docs/collaborating-in-postman/version-control-for-collections/#creating-pull-requests)

## Additional resources
- [Postman API](https://www.postman.com/postman/workspace/postman-public-workspace/documentation/12959542-c8142d51-e97c-46b6-bd77-52bb66712c9a) collection documentation

item.name: Submit a PR

response.name: get leaderboard

item.description:
Our time together is coming to an end. It's the final test of your Postman skills.

1. **Validate your solutions locally**: You should have been checking your solutions locally for every challenge. If you haven't done that already, run through those validations now since your pull request will not be accepted with any errors. 
1. **Update the example**: In this collection `Day 30: Submit a pull request`, find the example response (`e.g.`) for the `GET` request called `get leaderboard`. Edit the example by inserting your own information at the beginning of the array (Row 3-8).
  - Your `name` to display on the leaderboard. This can be anything within the [Postman Community Code of Conduct](https://www.postman.com/legal/community-code-of-conduct/).
  - Your `email` address associated with the Postman account to receive the badge. It's recommended to use a personal or permanent email address. Once awarded, the badge cannot be transferred to a new account. 
  - Your public `workspaceId` containing all your work.
  - Enter a `status` of "submitted". You can check back to see the status under review and approved.
  - Enter a `dateGranted` of "pending".
```
{
    "name": "Lucille Lin, PhD",
    "email": "joyce+lucy@postman.com",
    "workspaceId": "f21c2968-b83d-485e-9360-21fc4de72be3",
    "status": "submitted",
    "dateGranted": "pending"
},
```
1. **Create a pull request**: Save your changes to the example response, and then [create a pull request](https://learning.postman.com/docs/collaborating-in-postman/version-control-for-collections/#creating-pull-requests) to merge changes from your local forked collection (source) into the parent collection (destination). Tag at least one of the collection maintainers in the pull request description to review your PR. 

**Need help?** If you have a question related to the administration of this badge (e.g. not a technical Postman question), you can ask for guidance in the [Training](https://community.postman.com/c/training/38) section of the community forum.

Once your pull request is approved and merged, you will receive a **30 day challenge** badge to proudly display on your social media profiles.
